verses.verse: <WG1161> After<WG1893> he had ended<WG4137> all<WG3956> his<WG846> sayings<WG4487> in<WG1519> the ears<WG189> of the people<WG2992>, he entered<WG1525> into<WG1519> Capernaum<WG2584>.

Behold<WG2400>, they that<WG3588> are<WG1722> gorgeously<WG1741> apparelled<WG2441>, and<WG2532> live<WG5225> delicately<WG5172>, are<WG1526> in<WG1722> kings<WG934>' courts.

This <WG3778> is<WG2076> he of<WG4012> whom<WG3739> it is written<WG1125>, Behold<WG2400>, I<WG1473> send<WG649> my<WG3450> messenger<WG32> before<WG4253> thy<WG4675> face<WG4383>, Who<WG3739> shall prepare<WG2680> thy<WG4675> way<WG3598> before<WG1715> thee<WG4675>.

1161, 2962, Exodus36 Whereunto<WG5101> then<WG3767> shall I liken<WG3666> the men<WG444> of this<WG3778> generation<WG1074>, and<WG2532> to what<WG5101> are they<WG1526> like<WG3664>?

The Son<WG5207> of man<WG444> is come<WG2064> eating<WG2068> and<WG2532> drinking<WG4095>; and<WG2532> ye say<WG3004>, Behold<WG2400>, a gluttonous<WG5314> man<WG444>, and<WG2532> a winebibber<WG3630>, a friend<WG5384> of publicans<WG5057> and<WG2532> sinners<WG268>!

A <WG2258> certain<WG5100> lender<WG1157> had<WG2258> two<WG1417> debtors<WG5533>: the one<WG1520> owed<WG3784> five hundred<WG4001> shillings<WG1220>, and<WG1161> the other<WG2087> fifty<WG4004>.

<WG1161> When<WG2192> they<WG846> had<WG2192> not<WG3361> wherewith to pay<WG591>, he forgave<WG5483> them both<WG297>. <WG2036> Which<WG5101> of them<WG846> therefore<WG3767> will love<WG25> him<WG846> most<WG4119>?

Simon <WG4613> answered<WG611> and<WG1161> said<WG2036>, He<WG5274>, I suppose, to<WG3754> whom<WG3739> he forgave<WG5483> the most<WG4119>. And<WG1161> he said<WG2036> unto him<WG846>, Thou hast<WG2919> rightly<WG3723> judged<WG2919>.

Thou gavest<WG1325> me<WG3427> no<WG3756> kiss<WG5370>: but<WG1161> she<WG3778>, <WG846> since<WG575> the time<WG3739> I came in<WG1525>, hath<WG1257> not<WG3756> ceased<WG1257> to kiss<WG2705> my<WG3450> feet<WG4228>.

Wherefore <WG5484> I say<WG3004> unto thee<WG4671>, Her<WG846> sins<WG266>, which<WG3588> are many<WG4183>, are forgiven<WG863>; for<WG3754> she loved<WG25> much<WG4183>: but<WG1161> to whom<WG3739> little<WG3641> is forgiven<WG863>, the same loveth<WG25> little<WG3641>.
